column5: Is there anywhere to buy wine in Dryden? I know they have the beer store but don't care for beer that much. Thanks! Fred
Actually, the LCBO in Dryden has a fine wine selection. Dara, wine is either red or white, and comes in bottles with corks. You should try it some time...........

It is quite un-Canadian, but I don't care for beer either. We enjoy a good red wine and are always trying new ones. An old standby we get from our local LCBO (99 King Street in Dryden) is a Jackson-Triggs Shiraz (a Canadian wine), we buy it in a 4L box, but it is probably available by the bottle also, an inexpensive wine, but tastes good. I sometimes will buy wine by the case in the States that is not available in Canada and bring it in, I think the duty is about $6.00 per bottle if you chose to go that route.
